arm_group.description: Subjets in this arm receive acupuncture therapy in a new acupoint (leopard spot needling technique)
Subjects in this arm receive acupuncture therapy in a classical acupoint in the pericardial conduit (leopard spot needling technique)

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to test whether the application of acupuncture alters the
      mechanical (range of elbow extension motion) and physiological (eg, intensity and onset of
      discomfort, tingling feeling and/or feeling of tension or restriction of movement) responses
      of the neurodynamic test of nerve median in asymptomatic individuals

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effects of Acupuncture in the Response of the Median Neurodynamic Test

detailed_description.textblock:
To understand the potential of acupuncture therapy in pain syndromes that involve changes of
      the mechanics and physiology of the peripheral nervous system

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age > 18 years-old

          -  normal mobility in the joints of the upper quadrant

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  pathology that may impair nerve function (eg, diabetes)

          -  complaints over the past 3 months in the upper quadrant

          -  significant deformities in the upper quadrant

intervention.description: Comparison of the effects of a new or extraordinary acupoint versus a classical acupoint

facility.name: Instituto de Ciências Biomédicas Abel Salazar - Universidade do Porto

clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effects of Acupuncture in the Response of the Median Neurodynamic Test: a Randomised, Double-blind, Non-inferiority Trial

overall_official.affiliation: Universidade do Porto - Instituto de Ciências Biomédicas Abel Salazar

authority: Portugal: Ethics Committee for Clinical Research

primary_outcome.description: Elbow extension range of motion during the median nerve neurodynamic test is measured by means of a smartphone (iPhone 4; app Compass (native); iOS 7.1.1)
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after the application of acupuncture

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Master student in traditional chinese medicine

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
